concise_definition: v. 使遭受, 使服从, 使经受 (submit 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: To cause someone or something to experience or endure something unpleasant, difficult, or forced, often against their will or preference.
definitions.explanation_cn: 使某人或某物经历或承受某种不愉快、困难或被迫的情况，通常违背其意愿或偏好。
definitions.example_en: The prisoners were subjected to harsh conditions and inadequate food.
definitions.example_cn: 囚犯们遭受了恶劣的条件和不足的食物。

definitions.explanation_en: To place someone under the authority, control, or influence of another person or system, often implying a loss of autonomy.
definitions.explanation_cn: 使某人处于另一个人或系统的权威、控制或影响之下，通常暗示其自主权的丧失。
definitions.example_en: Colonial territories were subjected to the laws and governance of the imperial power.
definitions.example_cn: 殖民地被迫服从帝国的法律与统治。

definitions.explanation_en: To expose something to a particular process, test, or treatment, especially in scientific or technical contexts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 使某物经受某种特定的过程、测试或处理，尤其用于科学或技术语境中。
definitions.example_en: The material was subjected to extreme temperatures to test its durability.
definitions.example_cn: 该材料被置于极端温度下以测试其耐久性。

comparison.analysis: “Forced” (被迫) 强调外部压力或暴力导致的行为，侧重于“非自愿性”，但不必然包含长期或系统性的承受过程。而 “subjected” 更常用于描述持续性的、制度性或结构性的施加，语义更正式、更广泛。
“Exposed” (暴露) 指使某物处于某种环境或影响之下，但不一定带有负面或强制的含义，例如“exposed to sunlight”（暴露在阳光下）可以是中性的。而 “subjected” 隐含了被动承受、通常为不利后果的语义色彩。
“Compelled” (被迫做某事) 通常指被法律、道德或外力驱使去采取某种行动，强调“行动的强制性”。而 “subjected” 更侧重于承受某种状态或待遇，不一定是主动行为，而是被动经历。
